problems.title: Burning Rubber Smell / Brush Not Spinning
problems.description: Smoke or smell comes from the foot, brush roll stops.
solution_steps: Flip over, remove the plate (4 screws), and check the belt.
Replace the belt if it is loose or snapped.

problems.title: Loss of Suction / System Check Light
solution_steps: Rinse the blue filter under the bin.
Tap the black HEPA filter (do not wash). Replace if grey.
Clear the hose with a broom handle.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a WindTunnel T-Series Rewind Bagless?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $348 vacuum, and extending the life of your Hoover is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my WindTunnel T-Series Rewind Bagless needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include intermittent power and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my WindTunnel T-Series Rewind Bagless myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
